My Journey

My Footwear Philosophy

For me, shoes are about artistic expression and comfort in equal measure. I‚Äôm not chasing hype or trying to compete with serious collectors‚ÄîI simply love the experience of finding the perfect pair. Whether it‚Äôs for fashion, sports, or work, I believe in wearing your kicks and enjoying them. My approach balances reliability, comfort, aesthetic appeal, and price point to find shoes that truly work for my life.

The Collection & The Hunt

With over 15 pairs in my current rotation (heavily featuring Adidas, but I‚Äôm not brand-loyal), I‚Äôve developed a keen eye for what works. My collection is practical yet expressive, and my wishlist reflects my diverse taste‚Äîfrom the sleek lines of Jordan 1 Lows to the rugged appeal of Timberlands, the innovative design of Yeezys, and the classic comfort of Chelsea boots.

But my journey hasn‚Äôt been without its challenges. As someone with size 44 feet, I‚Äôve experienced the frustrating reality of inconsistent sizing across brands and even within the same brand. This has given me a unique talent: I can look at someone‚Äôs feet and accurately guess their shoe size‚Äîa skill born from paying close attention to the nuances of fit and proportion.

The Vision: Solving Real Footwear Problems

My experiences have shown me the gaps in the footwear world. Why should finding the right size be such a gamble? Why isn‚Äôt there a better way to track what works and what doesn‚Äôt across different brands and models?

I envision tools that make footwear shopping more reliable and collecting more organized. From a universal sizing database powered by real wearer experiences to a smart collection tracker that helps you plan your next purchase, I‚Äôm passionate about building solutions that serve both practical needs and personal expression.

After all, if I‚Äôm going to spend my last dollar on shoes, they better fit perfectly.

The Hit List

My ultimate wishlist spanning lifestyle, performance, and formal footwear

Nike Air Max Plus

High Priority $180 Nike Triple Black

The aggressive design and visible Air cushioning make this a statement piece. Perfect for casual wear with that 90s edge.

Air Jordan 1 Low OG

Grail $140 Jordan Mocha

The iconic silhouette in a more wearable low-top form. Versatile enough for any outfit, legendary enough to turn heads.

Air Jordan 11 Retro

Dream Pair $220 Jordan DMP Defining Moments

The patent leather, the history, the elegance. This is the shoe that made Jordan Brand legendary beyond basketball.

Air Jordan 4 Retro

Winter Essential $215 Jordan Winter

The perfect blend of street style and basketball heritage. The visible Air and unique lacing system make it instantly recognizable.

Adidas AE 2

Performance $140 Adidas Black/White/Red

Built for performance on the court. Ant's signature shoe combines style with the tech I need for serious hooping.

Timberland 6-Inch Premium Boot

Winter Essential $200 Timberland Wheat

The ultimate winter boot. Durable, waterproof, and iconic. A wardrobe staple that never goes out of style.

Adidas Yeezy 500

Comfort Focus $200 Adidas Clay Brown

Chunky, comfortable, and unmistakably Yeezy. The unique silhouette and all-day comfort make these perfect for long days.

Li-Ning Way of Wade Shadow 6

Performance $160 Li-Ning Miami Night

D-Wade's signature line with Li-Ning offers premium performance at a great price. Underrated tech for serious ballers.

Fun Facts

The First Rubber-Soled Shoes

The first rubber-soled shoes were created in the late 18th century and were called 'plimsolls' after the Plimsoll line on ships.

Shoes by the Numbers

The average American owns about 7 pairs of athletic shoes, while serious collectors often own 50+ pairs.

The Most Expensive Shoes

The most expensive athletic shoes ever sold were Michael Jordan's game-worn shoes from 1985, fetching $1.47 million at auction.

üåü Easy Mode

Which brand created the first basketball shoe specifically for the sport?

Converse created the All-Star in 1917, the first shoe designed specifically for basketball.

What does the term 'deadstock' mean in shoe culture?

Deadstock refers to shoes that are brand new, unworn, and in their original packaging.

Which Nike Air Jordan model is considered the most iconic and valuable?

The Air Jordan 1, released in 1985, is the most iconic and sought-after model, with some colorways selling for hundreds of thousands of dollars.

Which brand created the first basketball shoe specifically for the sport?

Converse created the All-Star in 1917, the first shoe designed specifically for basketball.

What does the term 'deadstock' mean in shoe culture?

Deadstock refers to shoes that are brand new, unworn, and in their original packaging.

Which Nike Air Jordan model is considered the most iconic and valuable?

The Air Jordan 1, released in 1985, is the most iconic and sought-after model, with some colorways selling for hundreds of thousands of dollars.

What year did Nike introduce the Air Max technology with a visible air unit?

Nike Air Max 1 was released in 1987, featuring the first visible Air cushioning unit designed by Tinker Hatfield.

Which brand's logo is known as 'The Three Stripes'?

Adidas is famous for its Three Stripes logo, which has been a signature design element since 1949.
